banks.title: FIGA & DFS Regulations
banks.description: Florida Insurance Guaranty Association and Department of Financial Services

sampleQuestions.stem: Under Florida insurance law, an agent who misappropriates premium funds intended for an insurance company faces which of the following consequences?
options: Administrative penalty only, limited to license suspension
Felony charges with potential imprisonment and restitution requirements
Automatic license revocation with no possibility of reinstatement
Civil monetary penalty equal to twice the misappropriated amount
sampleQuestions.explanation: Misappropriation of premium funds is treated as a felony under Florida law, with criminal penalties including potential imprisonment and mandatory restitution to affected parties.

sampleQuestions.stem: In an HMO network, when a provider is prohibited from balance billing, this means:
options: The provider cannot charge the patient anything beyond their copayment
The provider must accept the pre-negotiated rate as payment in full for covered services
The HMO pays 100% of all medical expenses with no patient responsibility
The provider can only bill the HMO and cannot bill the patient directly
sampleQuestions.explanation: Balance billing prohibition means HMO providers must accept the pre-negotiated rate as full payment for covered services, protecting subscribers from unexpected charges beyond their designated cost-sharing.

sampleQuestions.stem: The OASDI elimination period for Social Security Disability benefits is:
options: 3 months from the date of application
5 months from the onset of disability
6 months from the date of medical evidence
sampleQuestions.explanation: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) has a mandatory 5-month elimination period calculated from the established onset date of the disabling condition.

sampleQuestions.stem: FIGA coverage extends to all types of insurance policies issued by insolvent Florida insurers.
sampleQuestions.explanation: FIGA has specific exclusions and does not cover all types of insurance. Notable exclusions include certain commercial lines, reinsurance, and policies above statutory limits.

sampleQuestions.stem: A Return of Premium (ROP) rider on a term life policy is functionally equivalent to:
options: Decreasing term insurance with cash value
Increasing term insurance with premium return benefit
Whole life insurance with reduced face amount
Universal life insurance with flexible premiums
sampleQuestions.explanation: ROP riders are tested as increasing term insurance because the death benefit effectively increases each year by the amount of premiums returned, requiring additional coverage.
